title: _act_
author: _act_
content: You know how good ublock origin is? It is a good ads blocker, but only for desktop. On my phone, I have only been using the ads blocker on my browsers which are helpful, but I want to know if there is any ad blocker that is very common on phone, free and effective to block ads too. Is there any trustworthy mobile ads blocker?Although I like my browser ads blocker, some sites with ads do not allow me to visit their site unless I turn off my browser ads blocker. I do not think two times to leave sites like that.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I only use my browser adblocker on my mobile phone but if you wish to use Ublock origin on your mobile phone then you should use KIWI browser as it allows you to install extensions on your mobile phone. I used it back then to run bpip.org extension and it was cool although I haven’t tried any other extensions but you could try and see if it really works.

comments.author: UchihaSarada
comments.body: How to block ads on your Android phone or tablet?Did you look at Ad Guard?AdGuard officially releases its own DNS service, and it works with Android PieAdGuard Ad blocker for Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, browser extension.

comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on August 01, 2023, 11:37:39 AMIs there any trustworthy mobile ads blocker?There are many ads blockers for mobile phone use and you can get a list of them from here https://www.tomsguide.com/round-up/best-adblockers-privacy-extensions some of these ads blockers are free subscription while some could be paid service ads blockers, it also depends onnthe browser we use, some have this feature to block ads while some will requires us to enable their blocks using certain functions on the mobile phone, recommended ads blockers are on the list provided from the link above and check the compatible ones for your device.
